means: 热血的，血气方刚的，激动的

sentence.Network_en: Both of these dancers knew full well why they attracted the attentions of two hot-blooded young men.
sentence.Network_cn: 这两名舞蹈演员都深知自己何以吸引了两位热血青年的注意力。

sentence.Network_en: A hot - blooded person is one who easily shows strong feelings.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个易激动的人常常会表现出强烈的感情.

sentence.Network_en: It would be quite wrong to think of him as a hot - blooded man seething with temperament.
sentence.Network_cn: 由此得出结论,说他是一个脾气暴躁,易于激动的人,那是十分错误的.

entry.tran: 易激动的;感情冲动的;（尤指）敢爱敢恨的
entry.def: If you describe someone as hot-blooded, you mean that they are very quick to express their emotions, especially anger and love.

example.ex: Both of these dancers knew full well why they attracted the attentions of two hot-blooded young men.
example.tran: 这两名舞蹈演员都深知自己何以吸引了两位热血青年的注意力。
